result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Geo Demetri Owens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Geo Demetri Owens in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Geo Demetri Owens.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for plea hearing.  Court received notice via email that Attorney Aneeq Ahmad was retained by the Defendant yesterday afternoon and was not available to appear today due to prior court hearings.  Court confirmed with the Defendant that new counsel was retained.  The court finds good cause to Attorney Steinle's motion to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Geo Demetri Owens in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Geo Demetri Owens.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea hearing. Defense advises ongoing negotiations pending and requests adjourned projected guilty plea hearing.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Geo Demetri Owens in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defense requests additional time to review with client and requests a plea hearing be scheduled. 

Matter adjourned to Br. 9 for Plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Geo Demetri Owens in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court reminded the defendant to continue working with Justice Point.
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 056031,
Payable Number: 1013580,
Receipt Number: 22RP024239,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Geo Demetri Owens in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Geo Demetri Owens in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFEENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
